title: Leveraging Local and Global Descriptors in Parallel to Search Correspondences for Visual Localization

sections.learning based descriptor:
Although early hand-crafted local descriptors focused on gradient and intensity knowledge have been widely used, such as SIFT , ORB , BRISK , many researchers have attempted to design the learned counterparts with the increasing popularity of machine learning and emergence of annotated patch benchmarks . It seems that end-to-end descriptors learned from patches by CNNs have become a tendency in recent years. MatchNet  consists of a deep convolutional network that extracts descriptors from patches and a network of three fully connected layers that calculates a similarity between the extracted descriptors. DeepDesc [ref]22 adopts Siamese network and an aggressive mining strategy towards hardly classified patches while DeepCompare  studies several neural network architectures to improve the performance. TFeat [ref]24 utilizes triplets of training samples and in-triplet mining of hard negatives. HardNet [ref]25 minimizes distances of matching pairs, and meanwhile maximizes distances between patches and their “hardest-within-batch” negatives. GeoDesc  integrates geometry constraints from multi-view reconstructions to the learning process and provides guidelines of using learned local descriptors in structure-from-motion pipelines. SOSNet  incorporates a second order similarity regularization into its training process and designs a local descriptor evaluation method based on von Mises-Fischer distribution. L2-Net  takes descriptor compactness into account. DOAP  achieves better results by directly optimizing an average precision metric. In addition, SuperPoint , D2-Net , and R2D2  are the representatives of joint detection and description methods. They just need a whole image as input, then keypoints and their corresponding descriptors are extracted by a relatively complex network. Although most learning based local descriptors have achieved good performances in certain tasks, they are real-valued descriptors and cannot be embedded in random trees directly.
Therefore, we propose a weighted Hamming regularization term to keep discriminativeness of learning based local descriptors after binarization.
